content: free pattern @allfromjade no-sew squishy baby whale before you start materials notes #6 bulky yarn weight you can i used the yarn under/over use any yarn for this project technique for this pattern but this suggested yarns parfait chunky is not mandatory honey bunny baby snuggle work in a spiral do not join himalayan dolphin paintbox rounds or turn your work chenille etc use a stitch marker or a piece of yarn to mark the beginning of a 4mm crochet hook round move the marker up after 10mm safety eyes completing each round polyester fiberfill for stuffing yarn needle scissors stitch difficulty markers optional strand of pink yarn for beginner the cheeks copyrights abbreviations copyright © 2023 all from jade do not copy reproduce modify blo = crochet in the back loops publish or distribute this pattern only in any way you may sell finished decrease = invisible decrease products made with this pattern half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet stitch credit/tag me as the designer increase = increase - make 2 single crochet in the same stitch magic_ring = magic_ring single_crochet = single_crochet stitch slip_stitch s = slip_stitch es @allfromjade baby whale starting with head color r1 magic_ring of 8 single_crochet 8 r2 8 increase 16 step pictures on next page r3 7 single_crochet 1 increase x2 18 r4 18 single_crochet 18 r5 3 single_crochet fin 10 single_crochet fin 4 single_crochet tail 1 single_crochet 18 fin chain 3 starting in 2nd chain 1 slip_stitch 1 single_crochet and slip_stitch in same st of the head tail *chain 4 starting in 2nd chain 1 half_double_crochet 1 single_crochet 1 slip_stitch and slip_stitch in same st of the body* repeat twice change to belly color and cut head color r6 blo 18 single_crochet skip the sl sts made after the fins and tail 18 secure the eyes between rnds 4-5 about 1 st in front of the fins r7 1 single_crochet 1 decrease x6 12 stuff the whale r8 1 single_crochet 1 decrease x4 8 fasten_off cut a long yarn tail and close the opening optional embroider some cheeks under the eyes @allfromjade end of round 5 secure the eyes push the fins and tail out while working round 6 @allfromjade congratulations i hope you enjoy this quick little project don t forget to tag @allfromjade so i can see your makes thanks for your support
